Job Description:
Frontier Technology, Inc. is seeking a full-time MV-22 Operational Test Engineer/Analyst to join our team of qualified, talented, and diverse individuals in Yuma, AZ. Candidates will be required to relocate to Yuma, AZ. Relocation assistance will be provided.

Responsibilities:
This position is responsible for providing MV-22 System Engineering expertise in support of test and evaluation for the Department of the Navy’s (DoN) Commander, Operational Test and Evaluation Force (COMOPTEVFOR).
The successful candidate will provide operational test subject matter expertise while functioning as an expert in support of DoN test activities.
Ensure viability, traceability and control of test procedures
Work with the assigned Operational Test Director (OTD) to ensure the developed test plan and ensuing reports meet all COMOPTEVFOR, DOT&E and Joint testing requirements for assigned USMC Type/Model/Series aircraf
Provide support for:
Assigned project documentation and additional documentation as required to include:
Test and Evaluation Master Plan (TEMP) updates
Operational Test (OT) and Integrated Test (IT) Plans and Reports
Verification Correction of Deficiencies (VCD) related documentation
Ensure coordination of inputs to execute a safe, and operationally realistic test event(s)
Ensure the timely delivery of test related documents in preparation for, during, and after test events
Execute Knowledge of the IEF and Mission Based Test Design in creating an operationally realistic test plan, as well as concepts of Integrated DT/OT testing, Multi-service T&E and Joint T&E
Support the OTD in preparations for and execution of Operational Test Readiness Reviews for the various stages of testing
Assist the OTD in test design, execution and reporting

Education/Qualifications
(Preferred) minimum of 3 years of experience in planning and organizing test plan related work tasks, developing test plans, collecting data, and performing reconstruction and analysis for the test and evaluation of tactical operational systems.
(Preferred) Defense Acquisition Level 1 Test and Evaluation certification
Minimum of 2 years of direct experience with DoD/DoN instructions and policies with respect to Test and Evaluation, including for example, ORD/CDD/CPD, TEMP and Test Plan development and approval, Operational Assessment management, and IOT&E/OT&E/FOT&E decision milestone management.
Knowledge and understanding of historical aircraft and rotary wing test techniques and procedures used within DoD
Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field from an ABET accredited College or University.
Working knowledge of Department of Defense mission, activities
Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain a DOD Secret security clearance
Working knowledge of Department of Defense mission, activities and terminology.
Working understanding of the DoD 5000 series, OPNAVINST 5000.42 series, as well as SECNAVINST 5000 series instructions
Demonstrated ability to communicate and interact effectively with members of a diverse military and civilian team
Highly proficient in desktop computer applications, e.g. Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) a must.
FTI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Job Description: Data QA Engineer
Location: San Jose, CA

Job Description:
Affinity Solutions is looking for a self-motivated mid-level Data QA Engineer to lead the testing framework design, development, automation for our big data infrastructure leveraging latest technologies such as Hadoop and Spark, both on-premise and in the cloud. This position requires experience in testing and automation of data pipelines, data services, data warehouses, business intelligence and machine learning platforms, especially around unified consumer transactional, demographic and behavioral data.
The ideal candidate is a passionate and highly skilled individual, who can utilize programming and analytics tools/technologies such as SQL/NoSQL, Python, and Tableau to validate products, data pipelines and data deliverables. If you have experience in automation, quality engineering of data centric applications/systems, especially around credit/debit card transactions, unified consumer behavioral and profile data, and excited about leveraging your experience to catapult into hyper-growth, this job is for you.
Responsibilities:
Design and implement Test Automation frameworks using Python, node.js, SQL, javascript and React JS.
Develop test strategies, plans, test cases and engineering best practices related to software test engineering, both manual and automated testing with a specific focus on data quality
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists and analysts to inform solution designs in terms of testability.
Building and automating testing frameworks around data ingestion pipelines for master data management, deep-learning, and predictive analytics
Build and maintain testing frameworks for big data environments that are highly secure, scalable, flexible, and performant using appropriate SQL technologies.
Lead data governance and data profiling efforts to ensure data quality and proper meta data documentation for data lineage.
Creating quality metrics to evaluate data pipelines, products and customer deliverables.
Collaborate with diverse technical and non-technical teams located across multiple time-zones on client deliverables and technical support
Participate-in and contribute to design and code reviews
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field such as Mathematics and Statistics, preferably with focus on data analytics.
3+ years of experience in data integration / data engineering
3+ years of experience in data modeling and architecture
3+ years of experience in QA automation
Experience in working with large scale Enterprise data warehouse, data integration, data migration and data quality verification
Hands-on testing experience in working Hadoop, Spark and other Big data technologies is highly preferred
Knowledge of data pipelines using SQL, Hive, Spark, Spark ML
Excellent analytics, problem-solving and debugging skills

_*The Company*_
The world is facing a medical crisis, bacteria are increasingly evolving resistance to even our strongest antibiotics. The problem is already very real and immediate; for example, bloodstream infection leading to sepsis is now responsible for more than half of all deaths in hospitals and is the most expensive condition treated in hospitals. Sepsis mortality rate increases >6% every hour without effective antibiotic treatment. Yet, despite the life and death urgency, and healthcare cost impacts, current methodologies require 3 days to determine the correct antibiotic.

Specific Diagnostics has developed a breakthrough solution to rapidly determine the effective antibiotic treatment for bloodstream and other acute infections. Used for bloodstream infection Specific’s solution provides results 2 days sooner than existing methods, saving patients suffering from drug-resistant infection.

We have been funded by nearly $30 M in non-dilutive government sponsored research support and recently $17.5 M in venture capital. This is an opportunity to join us at an inflection point in our commercial growth as we bring our first key product to market and with recognition from major customers fueling an expansion of our staff.

_*The Job*_
This role is a key member of our development team, responsible for design, development, execution, and debug of test software based on software requirements and technical specifications. Central to the job is creation of test cases, development of test software and verification of results against requirements and generating a historical analysis of applications’ state and stability. Use of tools such as Jira and Arena for documentation of defects in a maintained issue tracking database will be a routine task. The job responsibilities include deploying, operating, and maintaining application test instances and development of automation wrappers for off the shelf test equipment.

You will be a key contributor in a fast track development program for a medical diagnostic system, and leadership experience in software development and test of FDA-regulated medical devices in an ISO 13485 quality environment is critical. The job includes reviewing and documenting software in compliance with medical device software standards including IEC 60601 and 62304. Testing against requirements includes evaluating software ease of usability and error handling procedures. Responsibilities include:
Design, develop, execute, and debug test plans of applications based on software requirements and technical specifications
Create test cases and validate results against functional requirements
Detect and identify software failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected
Quantify system reliability, scalability, load, and throughput
Develop automation wrappers for off the shelf test equipment
Document results and generate historical analysis of applications’ state and stability
Document defects in a maintained issue tracking database
Deploy, operate, and maintain application test instances
Ensure compliance with general software development, testing, and maintenance best practices
Evaluating software ease of usability and error handling procedures
Provide application instructions for users
You*
You better be great because you will be central to assuring our products are great and performing as required. You should have direct experience in the engineering development of software, test software, verification and validation of regulated medical devices. You will be part of a multi-disciplinary technical teams in collaboration toward system-level solutions, and demonstrated interpersonal skills and the ability to lead technical teams will be essential. Our software development is very diverse, and you will have the opportunity to work on various technologies and develop various aspects to our solution. You should be excited by the prospect of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment and have the following qualifications :
Experience in C#, WPF, and Python
Minimum 3 years of experience in automated testing, using, developing, and extending SW test frameworks
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other related field preferred.
Experience in automating WPF UI testing a plus
Experience with static analysis tools and code coverage tools
Experience with source control and defect tracking systems (Github, Jira, etc.)
Experience with electronics and related test equipment (e.g. Oscilloscope)
Must possess excellent written and verbal skills to communicate with the development team
Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment
Previous automated script design, coding, debugging and maintenance skills are a must
Experience with IEC 62304 medical device development, test, and documentation

Quality Assurance Engineer

Full time, direct hire

Digital Dynamics (DDI) is an employee owned (ESOP) company located in Scotts Valley, California, 10 minutes from Santa Cruz and just over the hill from Silicon Valley. Our company designs and manufactures custom Input/Output (I/O) controllers for industrial applications such as the semiconductor tool industry. We have 45 years of design and manufacturing experience, and a worldwide installed base of more than 80,000 units. Our employees describe the company as a challenging collaborative environment with a small company feel in a great location.

Role Description

The Quality Assurance Engineer supports DDI’s quality goals, processes, and the Quality Management System (QMS) by:

· Ensuring products meet DDI, Customer and industry established quality, reliability and compliance standards.

· Ensuring the assembly and testing of new products and RMA’s, cover requirements, and are repeatable and that the Manufacturing Process Instructions [MPI’s] and checklists for Assembly [API], Test [TPI] and Quality [QPI] Process Instructions (AKA - Process of Record) are current.

· Development and management of DDI’s processes, compliance with, and certification to industry standards, including, but not limited to ISO 9001-2015, IEC 61508 (International Electrotechnical Commission), FM (Factory Mutual), TUV, UL (Underwriter Lab), IPC-A-600 and IPC-A-610.

o Ensuring the Quality Manual and Departmental Process/Procedures are kept updated.

o Managing internal audits in support of ISO requirements and quality goals, including company audits to ensure process documents and procedures are being followed.

· Monitoring Silicon Expert (SE) and other industry data for component life cycle changes (EOL, industry allocations/shortages, and other notices from Suppliers, Partners, Customers, and others).

o Reviewing life cycle information and notices for validity and recommend actions to help mitigate risk to DDI and Customers.

o Maintain SE and SYSPRO AVL information to ensure both are up to date.

o Analyzing and developing solutions with Engineering to resolve all issues associate with obsolete components and supplies.

o Working with engineering to determine an appropriate resolution, including 2nd sourcing, alternate or replacement components, or a last time buy (LTB).

o Drive resolution on each instance: Redesign / LTB / Obsolete.

o Periodic (monthly) reports and updates, both internal and to external Customers (if required) on the “burn-down” of said EOL components.

o Customer specific implementation and annual training for both DDI and key suppliers on “Copy Exactly” (CE!)and “Process-of-Record” (POR)

· Implementation and maintenance of 6S (Sort, Set in Order, Shine, Standardize, Sustain and Safety) throughout the factory.

· Conflict Mineral and other compliance reporting, as required by Customers.

· Managing/hosting Customer or other factory, process, and quality audits.

· Interfacing with Customers on issues, projects and complaints, especially those that affect product quality and the resolution of quality issues, including being the focal point for managing the Customer Problem Report (PR) process, and interfacing with the Customer on the responses.

· Notifying Customers through their processes (Problem Reports, etc.) regarding quality or component end-of-life (EOL) issues and the potential impact to products and assemblies provided by DDI.

· Liaison with Engineering, Document Control, Quality Control, Supply Chain, Suppliers, Manufacturers and especially Customers, as required.

· Being the “Improvement Facilitator”. Someone who can look at the operations (not just manufacturing) and suggest and/or solicit suggestions for areas and/or processes that can be improved. To bring these suggestions to the EDIS (Employee-Driven Idea System) Committee as needed.

EDUCATION:

· Bachelor's degree (Required), Master’s Degree (Desired)

· Degree in Industrial Engineering (Preferred).

DESIRED EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:

· Minimum 10 years of experience in a QA/QC environment.

· Diplomatic skills and ability to positively interact with others, especially in this critical customer-facing role.

· Significant experience directly related to industry standards.

· Experience with International Standards Organization (ISO) 9001-2015 implementation and certification audits.

· Understanding mechanical and electronic systems manufacturing.

· Familiarity with manufacturing and design environments.

o IPC-A-600 (Acceptability of Printed Boards)

o IPC-A-610 (Acceptability of Electronic Assemblies)

· Experience and working knowledge of data collection, analysis setting, managing KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) and tools such as; SPC (Statistical Process Control), PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act), 6-Sigma, DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control), 8D’s, 5-Why’s, Fishbone, Pareto Charts, Check Sheets, FMEA (Failure Modes and Effects Analysis),VSM (Value Stream Mapping), flow charts, and corrective actions.

· Understanding of Document Control and ECO/ECN (Engineering Change Orders/Engineering Change Notices) processes.

· Experience in reading and understanding schematics, drawings and BOMs.

· Working knowledge of Silicon Expert (SE) or other Life Cycle software programs.

· Ability and experience in managing and training others, as required.

About Marvell


At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better.

The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below.

The Opportunity
The Infrastructure Processor Business Unit (IPBU) at Marvell designs and develops industry leading SoCs for wired and wireless infrastructure, leveraging IPBU’s core competencies of multi-core scaling, hardware acceleration (ex. packet and security), baseband design, software tool kits and reference enablement to provide scalable architectures and solutions that meet the compute, data-plane and baseband demands of network infrastructure such as enterprise APs, SMB, routers, switches, edge compute, core routers, firewalls, and macro/micro base stations. As a member of a dynamic NPI test development team, the candidate will be responsible for basic ATE test program development, characterization of new products, and understanding basic fault and test coverage models.

Responsibilities:

- Understanding basic ATE test program structure and flow

- Understanding basic production flow for processor products

- Understanding basic fault, test coverage, and yield models

- Develop scripts using Perl, Python,… to parse raw test data

- Perform characterization on new products and generate standard characterization reports

Minimum Qualifications:

- Recent graduate with a BS/MS (preferred) degree in EE or related technical field(s)

- Have taken classes on basic electrical circuits theory and programming language (C/C++)

- 0-1 years of previous experience

Preferred Qualifications:

- Recently completed BS/MS in EE and good verbal and written communication skills

- Good understanding of Perl script writing techniques

- Strong Programming Skills in C/C++, in a Unix type environment, with good problem solving skills

- Experience working on ATE test platforms is a strong plus
The Perks


With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

Your Future


Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Any applicant who requires a reasonable accommodation during the selection process should contact Marvell HR Helpdesk at GR-HR-Services-Americas@marvell.com or 408-222-3604.

Job Description:

Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer

Would you like to join an innovative team creating technology to power groundbreaking insights in academic, clinical, pharma and biotech research?

Fluidigm is looking for a Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer to join an innovative team creating technology to power groundbreaking insights in academic, clinical, pharma and biotech research! It is an extraordinary time for Fluidigm. Our technology is empowering customers to improve life through comprehensive health insight.

We invite you to join a leading provider of indispensable life sciences tools that is accelerating global research on multiple frontiers of human health. Fluidigm offers a highly competitive compensation package, including better-than-average benefits and growth opportunities. At Fluidigm we are also building a positive culture where our people can do the best work of their careers, informed and influenced by our core values:

· Create what customers need next.

· Drive to make a difference.

· Collaborate and learn.

· Step up.

Essential duties include but are not limited to:

Develop (direct responsibility) and review (participate) throughout the entire software development cycle. Deliverables include:

System and software development plan.
Software requirements specification and software design.
Off-The-Shelf (OTS) software selection and verification.
Verification and validation plans and test cases (protocols), including usability, function, performance, load/stress, integration and security as required.
Test case execution, coverage analysis and
Risk analysis and risk acceptance criteria.
Traceability matrices.
Peer reviews
Software release management
Support Internal and external customers.
Support documentation efforts for regulatory submissions.
Identify and recommend for improvements of software life cycle process.
Identify, recommend and implement software tools to improve the testing efficiency.
Manage defect tracking and resolution.
Support to software related CAPA (Corrective And Preventive Action).
Review and approve software related change order.
Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Science or Engineering
5+ years of software quality assurance experience in the medical device industry including direct experience with software in a regulated enviroment such as In-Vitro Diagnostic device (IVD) in the United States and European markets.

Working knowledge of applicable regulation and standards (e.g., ISO-13485, ISO-14971, and IEC- 62603).
In-depth experience in developing software engineering document, including: Design Inputs and Outputs, Verification and Validation protocols and reports, Risk Management Plans, and Risk Analyses.
Experience in automated testing software program.
Ability to develop scripts for automated testing.
Analytical skill to solving complex problem without ambiguity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent attention to detail, strong organization skills, and ability to work independently and in team.

We Will:

Support you in your ongoing development and contribution both as an employee and a person.
Value your contribution and enlist your feedback.
Host excellent company-wide events multiple times a year. (Post Covid-19)
Offer onsite yoga classes, massages, randomly free and good food, friendly greetings, gym equipment and, seriously, a lot more.

Ready to join an industry leader with a bold and ambitious mission that is enabling advancements in human health? Apply online with your resume!

Software QA Engineer III is responsible for complete end-to-end verification of Natera software systems and services using both manual and automated test strategies.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform software verification, define and execute test cases and scenarios required for software quality assurance and regulatory compliance.
Perform system analysis, assess risk, and develop strong test strategies by analyzing product design and technical specifications, and by collaborating with product managers and developers.
Participate in building and maintaining data-driven test automation framework using automation tools and libraries.
Perform debugging and root cause analysis of product issues or defects.
Evangelize new testing methodologies, best practices and tools with goals to continuously improve test coverage.
Work closely with developers in all phases of SDLC to build quality into our development process.
This role works with PHI on a regular basis both in paper and electronic form and has access to various technologies to access PHI (paper and electronic) in order to perform the job
Employee must complete training relating to HIPAA/PHI privacy, General Policies and Procedure Compliance training and security training as soon as possible but not later than the first 30 days of hire.
Must maintain a current status on Natera training requirements.
Employee must pass post offer criminal background check.
QUALIFICATIONS:

BS Degree in Computer Science or similar discipline; or equivalent work experience
4+ years of experience testing both front-end and server-side functionality of complex n-tier systems
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

Extensive knowledge of QA methodologies, test planning, system dependencies, and product integration phases.
Experience working with relational databases, strong practical knowledge of SQL
Recent hands­on experience developing test automation code using tools and libraries, such as Selenium, TestNG, Junit and others.
Understanding of one or more of additional programming and scripting languages, such as Scala, Python, Ruby, Groovy, or other.
Recent hands-on experience with front-end test automation tools and libraries such as Selenium, TestNG, Junit,ScalaTest, Gatling and others.
Strong knowledge of Linux and command line shell scripting.
Strong knowledge of QA methodologies, test planning, system dependencies, and product integration phases.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
OUR OPPORTUNITY

Driven by the passion for elevating the science and utility of genetic testing, Natera is committed to helping families identify and manage genetic diseases. Natera is a rapidly-growing diagnostics company with proprietary bioinformatics and molecular technology for analyzing DNA. Our complex technology has been proven clinically and commercially in the prenatal testing space and we are actively researching its applications in the liquid biopsy space for developing products with oncology applications.

The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, youll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, youll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.

WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive Benefits. Healthy catered lunches, Premium snacks and beverages, Onsite gym with cardio and weight-training equipment, Game room with satellite TV, Onsite dry cleaning and alteration service with pick-up and delivery, Employee-organized sport leagues, Happy hours and BBQs, Generous Employee Referral program.

For more information, visit www.natera.com.

Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Enterprise Networking products integrate industry-leading routing, application services, security, and voice/video features with new technologies such as virtualization, 5G mobile data, cloud-based IT applications, DNA, Switching, Routing and WAN.

Why Provident

Provident Credit Union is member-owned, trusted, financially sound, technologically advanced, and provides "world class" value, convenience, products and services to all members. We are headquartered in Redwood Shores, CA and have 21 branches located throughout the San Francisco Bay Area, and Folsom.

Summary:

The Software Quality Assurance Analyst will work with dynamic and hard-working teams to help improve the quality of software developed for core business applications and digital services. Works closely with business analysts, developers, product management, customer service and other internal groups to proactively seek product information, develop in depth test plans, derive practical use cases, and author appropriate test cases. Prepares complex data sets to test logic, error handling and system workflows.

Tests the most complex features of new software releases using pre-defined test plans and scripts to identify defects. Documents results and uses designated systems and tools to track outcomes. Performs follow-up rounds of testing as needed. Performs functional black and white box testing and test automation where applicable. Develops and maintains the test automation framework.

Duties/Responsibilities:
Conduct functional-level testing including both GUI and back-end tests.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate them into actionable and measurable tasks to ensure timely and effective testing for product releases.
Coordinate and lead efforts for cross functional testing and/or integration tasks on a project basis.
Develop and/or maintain test scripts for GUI (Wed Based and Java based standalone application) and back-end automation.
Writes and maintains test automation scripts, processes and procedures.
Develops quality assurance standards.
Advises development team members on quality concerns.
Supports design and development practices.
Defines and tracks quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and open defect counts.
Perform qualitative and/or quantitative tests/evaluations of products, processes, equipment, and systems to support validation requirements.


Education/Training:
Degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering or minimum 5 years equivalent work experience in testing or programming.
Job Knowledge/Experience:
5+ year's software testing experience.
3+ year's test automation software experience.
Experience in both white and black box testing, performance/load testing web apps.
Experience with testing web-based and java-based standalone applications.
Experience developing test plans, designing, implementing, executing and analyzing test cases, writing bug reports, and assessing risk.
Familiarity with defect-tracking software and processes including but not limited to Selenium (browser based applications), IBM's RFT, HP QPT, Micro Focus (HPE) UFT and Appium.
Familiarity with C# and .Net application programming.
Experience with multi-tiered web technologies including web servers and application servers.
Must have a working knowledge of quality assurance methodologies.
Familiar with Microsoft environments, products and testing methodologies and automation tools.
Proven track record working with development teams to perform quality assurance assignments.
Familiarity with GUI standards a plus.
Experience in GUI automation tools is a plus.
Must have adequate mastery of the English language in order to convey meaning verbally and in written documents in the form of manuals, policies and day-to-day internal communications with colleagues, vendors and staff.
Possess ability to articulate complex technical information/issues (e.g. architecture/design errors) to team in clear concise manner (written and verbal).

Airtable presents many unique challenges as a product that covers a wide range of use cases used by people of all backgrounds. As a Contract Quality Assurance Analyst you will develop test cases and debug issues that our users might encounter. You're not just testing across devices and browsers, but across teams, applications, and use cases. There are regular product additions and improvements, so you'll be able to shape and improve the Airtable experience for users everywhere.

What you'll do
Moderate to high level understanding of how app's and websites work, understanding of API's, relational databases, and development frameworks
Comfortable getting into dev console or looking at a stack trace to help debug an issue, and are able to reproduce complex bugs with minimal reproduction steps
Has good product design and UX sensibilities, can build test plans that account for multiple use cases
Takes initiative on opportunities to improve the QA process, and to expand test coverage and capabilities
Is able to look at a change and see how it impacts user workflows and can anticipate pain points and suggest enhancements or provide workarounds
Who you are
You have two to four years of technical coursework and/or cumulative years of QA experience working with a technical team
You can create flexible and reusable test cases that can cover a wide range of use cases and edge cases
You understand that testing thoroughly is the key to provide best opportunity for multiple teams to succeed. You are comfortable working with other teams to understand common pain points and incorporate into new test scenarios
You have empathy for your users (and your coworkers) and high emotional intelligence
Nice to have: mobile testing experience a plus; familiarity with Java, Swift; willingness or ability to maintain automation tests (low to "no-code" alternatives are also ok); proficiency with formulas, or proficiency with Airtable
About Airtable


Airtable is working on the next computer revolution: one where anyone even without technical training can create customized applications that fit their needs, build more interconnected teams, and take part in a growing community of people who share what they create. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in San Francisco, Airtable powers teams at more than 200,000 organizations around the world.

Our recent Series D funding round, which included Thrive Capital, Coatue, and Benchmark, doubled our total investment to more than $350 million. And we're just getting started.

Job Title: Wi-Fi / Smart Home Solutions Test Engineer
Job Description:
Calix is seeking a talented and passionate test engineer for a smart home solutions test team. The position is part of a global test team that is providing software testing and quality assurance on an industry disrupting ecosystem comprised of cloud, IoT/embedded systems, and mobile applications. This role works in parallel with development as part of an end-to-end testing plan and maintains a checks and balances approach throughout the development process. The ideal candidate would work out of the Calix Richardson, TX office, but remote opportunities could be considered based on experience, etc.

Responsibilities/Duties:
The ideal candidate is one that is detail-oriented, process-oriented/aware, and is self-motivated.
They will take ownership of the smart home integration and test environment which is heavily Wi-Fi focused.
Independently set day to day work priorities while working to achieve the goals of the team/organization in a dynamic fast-paced work environment.
Author test plans, execution of tests, reporting of software issues and test results, reproduction and development support for smart home solution-oriented testing.
Work with 3rd party and various internal cross-functional organizations to analyze test results/field scenarios and reproduce and identify issues.
Depending on the level of experience, they will provide technical leadership and guide solution testing in focused areas.
Technical Qualifications:
6+ years of software/hardware test experience on either cloud, IoT/embedded systems, or mobile applications; preferably all.
Hands-on experience with xDSL, GPON, Ethernet, etc. access transport methods.
Hands-on experience with basic and some advanced networking technologies with an in-depth understanding of the TCP/IP protocol suite (IPv4, IPv6, TCP, UDP, and other upper layer application protocols).
Hands-on experience with Wi-Fi testing (802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax) and to be able to effectively debug Wi-Fi system/protocol-level issues.
Hands-on experience with smart home protocols such as Zigbee, Z-Wave, BLE.
Excellent debugging skills, the ability to articulate defects with detail, and excellent verbal/written communication skills while working with local/remote teams to help understand issues, address lab network issues, etc.
Must have excellent understanding of various testing methodologies and be able to implement comprehensive test strategies that examine a complex ecosystem.
Hands-on experience with performance test methods and tools; e.g. – IxChariot, Spirent, Octoscope, Ixia, etc.
Hands-on experience and performance testing of multicast IPTV and OTT video delivery systems is a plus.
Hands-on experience with Python automation with the ability to develop scripts and maintain framework independently is a plus.

Responsibilities
Designs, develops, and implements cost-effective methods of testing and troubleshooting analog and mixed-signal power management semiconductor products
Prepares test and diagnostic programs
Designs test fixtures and equipment
Completes the required specifications and procedures for new product development
Supports and is responsible for sustaining and continuous improvement of production test for multiple products
Competencies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Analytical in nature; adept at troubleshooting and problem solving
Ability to achieve results, meet deadlines, and adjust to quickly changing priorities
Requirements
BS, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
Strong experience and skills with regards to software C++ programming, computer hardware, and networking
Knowledge of C/C++ is required
Familiarity with statistical methods of tester and program comparisons is a plus
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as Test Development Engineer.
Preferably in Analog or mixed-signal Test.
Preferably ETS88 or ETS364 development experience.

Description

At Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? We develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible.

Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the beginning, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and improve people's lives.

If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx, we care deeply about creating significant development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We champion an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.

Xilinx’s production verification team is responsible for developing state-of-the-art test solutions for FPGAs, 3D-ICs, Programmable SoCs, and ACAPs. We are looking for a talented, self-driven and motivated engineer to join our team of experienced and accomplished engineers.

As a DFT Engineer, you will be working with cutting-edge Xilinx devices, including next generation ACAPs. Based on TSMC’s 7nm technology, ACAPs are ideally suited to accelerate a broad set of applications in the emerging era of 5G, big data and artificial intelligence. As part of test solutions development, you will be using Xilinx industry leading Vivado Design Suite to develop RTL based test designs and Vitis Software Platform to develop diagnostic firmware for failure analysis.

In this position, you will have a unique and exciting opportunity to use your design, debug, and verification skills to test, verify and validate FPGA Fabric resources in Combinatorial-Logic-Blocks (CLBs), Interconnect Matrices, and High-Speed Clock Distribution Networks. You will architect and develop test methodologies and flows for testing Xilinx devices, and in return, you will gain valuable hands-on experiences as part of your career development.

Key responsibilities for this challenging and rewarding opportunity include but are not limited to the followings:

• Verify pre-silicon functional behaviors using RTL simulations
• Develop high coverage and cost effective DFT test methodologies
• Create and implement test plans in Automatic-Test-Equipment (ATE) test environments
• Debug test patterns and deliver robust and stable manufacturing test flows
• Analyze test coverages to achieve excellent out-going qualities for every device
• Develop diagnostic firmware using C code and running in on-chip embedded Microcontroller to root cause failing mechanisms and improve manufacturing yields
• Characterize post-silicon performance across test conditions using volume manufacturing test data
• Write custom automation tools to facilitate test developments and debug test failures

Education Requirements

• BS or MS in Electrical / Electronic / Computer Engineering

Years of Experience

• 3 to 5 years of experience as IC Design / Verification / Product / Test / DFT Engineer

Qualifications

• Good understanding of IC design and verification concepts
• Good understanding of IC design test methodology and fault models analysis
• Knowledge of using industry standard IC design flows and tools
• Knowledge in VHDL / Verilog design languages
• Proficient in Perl / Python / TCL / Shell scripting languages running in Linux environment
• Experience in coding in C for embedded processors is highly desirable
• Experience in working with FPGA is a plus
• Must be a self-motivated individual to learn and adapt to new and dynamic situations due to unanticipated requirements
• Must be a strong team player with excellent communication skills and work well across different teams spanning multiple continents

Job Title: Sr. Automation Test Engineer - CPO Analytics
Job Description:
The Cash Product Office is national business line of the Federal Reserve System. Currently, we have multiple opportunities for Software Quality Assurance professionals (Sr. Automation Test Engineers) in our organization, and these roles can reside in San Francisco, California, Cleveland, Ohio or Richmond, Virginia. If you are interested in working for a mission driven organization that is doing good in our communities, where you can enjoy both interesting/stable work, and a work-life balance that puts you and your family first, then apply for here for all locations!

The Cash Product Office (CPO) is responsible for the strategic direction and national support for Federal Reserve Cash Services (FedCash® Services). The CPO incorporates our core values of Community, Service, Expertise, Resiliency and Curiosity in to how we work and interact with each other, and the broader community. These core values are representative of what we want our customers and partners to experience when they interact with us.

National Cash Automation (NCA), is CPO’s software development and support team, and we maintain and improve the Fed's cash operations suite of automation solutions. We are embarking on a large new program we call “NextGen”. NextGen will modernize and upgrade the hardware and software used to manage the cash supply chain across the entire Fed system.

Our ideal candidate is an experienced Automation Test Engineer with a hands-on coding skill set and experience testing Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence products and cloud based solutions (AWS). Beyond your testing expertise, you have a strong curiosity and desire to understand the business and bigger picture of what you are testing, and this adds real value to your work. You should have successfully tested software components as part of large, highly integrated, enterprise class development projects. The position requires strong “systems thinking” ability, integration test expertise, technical and functional analytical skills, and significant test automation/coding/scripting experience as well as a flexible and adaptable mindset.

Essential Responsibilities:
Perform test activities within analytics and data management domains.
Utilize advanced SQL and ETL techniques to validate data in advanced database structures, data lakes, data warehouse and SAP BI reporting tools.
Perform requirements and user story analysis to create detailed test designs and conditions.
Assist with setup and maintenance of test environments.
Develop configurable, maintainable, reusable and dependable test automation tools.
Prepare for and takes part in testing activities for production deployments and remediation.
Provide traceability from business requirements and technical specifications to test conditions and problem reports.
Participate in detailed review walkthrough sessions.
Willing and able to knowledge transfer/mentor peers on test automation best practices where appropriate.
Track issues to successful resolution.
Collect metrics to measure test progress and quality outcomes.
Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information System or related field or equivalent professional experience.
Typically requires three or more of professional experience in automation coding and software testing.
Experience with Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting and Data Warehouse tools.
Experience in Data Warehouse (DW) testing and testing with SAP Business Intelligence (BI).
AWS Cloud testing experience is required.
Experience with Agile methodology is required.
Helpful:

Experience testing Tableau highly desired
Experience using HP ALM/Quality Center
Experience with Informatica
Any performance testing background helpful
At the Federal Reserve Banks, we offer wonderful benefits including: Dental, Vision, Pre-tax Flexible Spending Account, Backup Child Care Program, Pre-tax Day Care Flexible Spending Account, Vacation Days, Sick Days, Paid Holidays, Pet Insurance, Matching 401(k), and an unheard of Retirement / Pension.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

At the Federal Reserve Bank, we believe in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. The Federal Reserve Banks are Equal Opportunity Employers.

Job Description:
JOB REQUISITION

QA Engineer II

LOCATION

SAN RAMON

JOB DESCRIPTION

As QA Engineer II , your specific responsibilities include :

Be able to understand business process and system requirements to develop relevant automated test scenarios.
Prepare test data and scripts, working with functional and technical groups as needed.
Develop configurable test scripts with high re-usability, that results in a suite of automated test cases or performance test scripts.
Follow best practices associated with code management and documentation.
Develop accurate test scenarios based on nonfunctional requirements.
Expert at applying standard functional test concepts to automated test design.
Be able to execute testware and document identified defects. Identify and document defect root cause.
Be able to configure and troubleshoot testware errors / warnings to ensure accurate results are obtained.
Document test summary report of results and be able to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences.
Provide code and automation recommendations that will improve efficiency and effectiveness of automation suite.
Develop test approach to ensure common framework and identify issues for test planning and execution.
Be able to understand project expectations and manage to deadlines.
Be able to provide accurate effort estimates for automation efforts.
Identify risks or challenges associated with testing effort.
Be able to delineate team tasks as associated with overall testing effort and understand dependencies / entry criteria to start test case design.
Have a perspective on the types of test that are ideal candidates for automation.
Work with the engineering leads/business analysts to understand project architecture, business requirements, and nonfunctional requirements to devise an test automation or performance test strategy.
Collaborate with the engineering lead/business analysts to identify and define test scenarios and cases for test automation.
Facilitate the gathering and documenting of automation test objectives and requirements for input into automation test plan.
Confirm problems and document as defects in QA problem tracking tool.
Raise issues impacting quality, deadlines or productivity to QS leadership as appropriate.
Provide weekly status on test progress against work plan, including risks and issues.
Collaborate with lead to incorporate best practices associated with tools and test methodology.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years’ experience in test planning, execution and validation or application development.
5+ years’ of experience with system performance testing.
5+ years’ of LoadRunner, Jmeter or similar tool experience required.
5+ years’ of QTP experience preferred.
5+ years’ of test automation tools such as QTP or Selenium experience preferred.
Additional experience in test collaboration, application development, test automation or other related areas preferred.
Ability to work independently and as a part of a team or a technical lead.
Software test planning, execution and validation.
Planning, configuration and execution of test automation scenarios.
Analysis report configuration and generation.
Experienced in defining, configuring and executing test sets from Quality Center.
Strong knowledge of software development technologies including ASP.Net/C#, ASP/VBScript, XML, SQL and Java.
Familiarity with the overall application development life cycle.
Capable of balancing multiple priorities.
Strong analytical and problem solving ability.
Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Excellent planning, organizing and follow-up skills.
High integrity and a desire to work within a team environment.

Job Title: QA Analyst - Fluent in spoken/written Chinese
Job Description:
Company Description

Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market.

We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.

Job Description

We’re looking for a talented individual who wants to make an immediate impact on a fast growing company.

As a QA Analyst, you’ll become an expert in the health and quality of Wish’s platform and product. This role entails executing manual test plans, leading high impact projects and initiatives, and proactively reporting issues to ensure that our platform and product provide a seamless user experience. The ideal candidate is someone who takes initiative in solving problems and has prior experience in manual testing and automation.

What you'll be doing:
Manually test in Chinese
Execute daily manual testing across various platforms to ensure functionality
Create and test manual test cases as new features are being developed
Document issues and suggest improvements on features and processes
Lead high impact projects and initiatives
Collaborate with the engineering team to help reproduce and resolve issues
Communicate product changes to the appropriate teams
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in a STEM field from a reputable institution or equivalent work experience
3+ years experience in mobile and web testing at another software company
Fluent in spoken and written Chinese
Passion for product quality and a positive user experience
Knowledge of QA methodologies, best practices, and software development life cycle
Ability to learn quickly and manage priorities in a fast paced development environment
Experience in project management
Highly driven and proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with software tools for source control, bug tracking, and code coverage
Proficient in Python and Selenium
Experience automating test cases
Previous experience working in a startup environment
#LI-BD1

Additional Information

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

At GenapSys we are working to power the world of healthcare and diagnostics with advanced DNA sequencing technology. Our sequencing instrument platform leverages a proprietary electrical microfluidic sequencing chip with a scalable number of detectors, enabling a wide range of applications including targeted sequencing in oncology, pharmacogenomics and genome-wide sequencing in microbiology and others. We believe in a world where every researcher has a compact, scalable, and affordable sequencer in their own lab, empowering the democratization of genetic sequencing. Our novel sequencing method is revolutionizing genomics discovery, biomedical research, healthcare, diagnostics, agriculture, and a variety of other fields.

Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. It is a super exciting time to join GenapSys as we recently launched our first product which is generating a tremendous amount of interest.

About the Role:

The Product and Test Engineer will be responsible for our next generation product engineering as well as maintaining test and operation of current DNA sequencing chips. We are looking for individuals with experience in developing custom assembly processes. Those who are intimately familiar with semiconductor assembly processes and equipment as well as ATE test. The role involves vendor management as well as interface with different R&D and engineering team within GenapSys.

Responsibilities:
Supply chain management for wafer fabrication and chip assembly, including substrate design and manufacturing.
Drive development and running ATE tests for volume manufacturing.
Create and document product requirement for manufacturing, assembly and production test.
Prepare assembly drawing and assembly process steps.
Prepare acceptance criteria for chip assembly and test.
Interface with device assembly and packaging houses.
Characterize, qualify, and analyze failures of the fabricated devices and sensors.
Yield analysis and enhancement.
Cost reduction.
Qualifications:
BS/MS in EE or mechanical engineering.
5+ years of experience in semiconductor chip assembly and test.
Experience with quality audit of fabrication, assembly, and test houses.
Experience with wafer level data analysis for volume manufacturing.
Successful track record of yield analysis tools and yield improvement techniques.
Successful track record of cost reduction and on time delivery of products.
Knowledge and relationship with offshore CMOS FAB, packaging, and test houses.
Successful experience with Failure analysis on semiconductor chips.
Great interdisciplinary team work and Good documentation.
What we offer (US based-employees)*:
Competitive compensation and generous stock options.
Comprehensive, industry-leading medical, dental and vision benefits for employees and dependents.
Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses.
401(k) retirement plan with matching employer contribution.
Free daily catered gourmet lunches and snacks.
For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program.
Work with driven and enthusiastic colleagues in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment, the opportunity to work on problems that matter in a highly collaborative environment.
*Eligible international employees' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

GenapSys does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any GenapSys employee. GenapSys will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees absent a formal agreement.

A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of GenapSys' culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!

Calix is seeking a talented and passionate engineer to lead hardware system quality assurance within the hardware development group. This position makes sure things don’t fall through the cracks at the boundary of hardware and software integration. The ideal individual understands both hardware and software design as well as testing. They will be responsible for enumerating all hardware capabilities and establishing a plan to verify proper hardware-software system behavior. This position assures the hardware-software integration is robust with no defects escaping into the field. The lead will develop custom test hardware, automated test suites and robust diagnostics suites. This position coordinates with multiple organizations within Calix including hardware engineering, software development and test, manufacturing test, customer service and technical assistance.

Responsibilities
Establish base hardware-software system requirements. Collecting from source authors or in some cases authoring the requirements. Reverse engineering software to establish designed functionality.
Determine rank ordered backlog of highest value functional areas to test first.
Determine necessary equipment and compile a fixed asset plan.
Coordinate with other organizations within Calix to share resources when appropriate.
Establish the test plans including white box techniques to stimulate software response.
Contribute to the bring up of new hardware designs.
Build or contract to build custom test hardware.
Build or contract to build automated, scripted test environments.
Contribute to overall company regression test capability.
Utilize access to live deployed product to gather system operational data.
Execute test plans for all hardware in scope.
Generate and track bugs as a result of test plan failures.
Qualifications
10+ years of software/hardware design and test experience.
BSEE, BSCS or related degree, MS preferred
Linux expertise
Embedded systems experience
Experience building software tools and test scripts in C/Python, whatever is most appropriate to the task
Proficient with gnu tool chain and Software Configuration Management tools such as Git
Proficient with the Atlassian tool suite
Knowledge of test debugging and test validation
Excellent analytical and integration skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skill

At Nuna, our mission is to make high-quality healthcare affordable for everyone. We are dedicated to tackling one of our nation's biggest problems with ingenuity, creativity, and a keen moral compass.

Nuna is committed to simple principles: a rigorous understanding of data, modern technology, and most importantly, compassion and care for our fellow human. We want to know what really works, what doesn't—and why.

Nuna partners with healthcare payers, including government agencies, health plans, and employers, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning.

YOUR TEAM


As a Quality Engineer you'll help us shape the quality of our software. This will demand deep integration with our development engineers, creating test plans, regression testing, testing new features, and identifying holes in coverage.

YOU BRING

PURPOSE OF POSITION: *
The Test Engineer will perform the following functions:
Develop, implement and support test processes for the Production of a variety of products including Servers, switches and storage devices.
Develop techniques to troubleshoot failing systems as quickly and efficiently as possible.
Create work instructions and update online documentation for testing, troubleshooting, and repairing all CCBU products assembled at QMN.

Test Engineer will be expected to drive test process efficiency improvements reducing Time-to-Fail and overall test time while maintaining integrity of test and quality of product shipped.

Support the launch of new products at QMN. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*
Develops automated test processes to enhance and insure the reliability and quality of new and existing products

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES*

Strong problem solving and analytical skills;

Ability to work independently and with a team.

Job Title: Lead Quality Assurance Engineer (San Francisco, CA)
Job Description:
Earnest LLC - San Francisco, CA

Title: Lead Quality Assurance Engineer

Duties: The Lead Quality Assurance Engineer at Earnest LLC in San Francisco, California will work with an agile, cross-functional scrum team to deliver high-quality software by collaborating on requirements/designs, writing test cases, manually testing new features, and writing and maintaining automated regression tests. Serve as a functional expert on the scrum team, and develop and execute test plans, scripts and procedures. Groom existing test cases for selection into smoke/regression suites. Retest and document follow-through with failure resolution; work cross-functionally with product, design and engineering as part of a scrum product development process. Gather requirements and processes to be implemented into the Earnest software ecosystem. Design, automate and execute test strategies for applications/features. Develop and maintain test automation frameworks and tests cases. Document, report and communicate failures discovered through testing with the affected teams. Drive overall quality assurance by engineering disciplines in versioning, documentation, and deployment processes. Proactively explore for weaknesses and failure points in requirements, user stories, and test cases, and imagine ways users may understand prescribed flows for a feature or application. Regress, isolate and report issues found during testing. Mentor Software Engineers, and provide coding and architecture feedback to other engineers using Github.

Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a closely related field plus 5 years of experience as a software quality engineer. The 5 years of experience must include 5 years of work experience with each of the following: (1) Cypress, NightWatch, Mocha, Chai, SuperTest, GraphQL and MochaAwesome; and (2) with Unit Testing written in JEST and Cucumber testing framework. Must also have: (1) 3 years of work experience with Jenkins, CircleCi, Docker and Kubernetes; (2) 3 years of work experience of using testing tools including Spunk, Postman, Swagger, Insomnia, Postico, Dbeaver, New Relic, New Relic, Amplitude, and Looker; (3) 2 years of Big Data and Machine learning development experience with using ReactJS, NodeJS, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and TypeScript; and (4) 1 year of work experience using code coverage metrics across engineering using SonarCloud and nyc frameworks.

Interested candidates must apply online at www.earnest.com/careers. Contact Anna Farnsworth at anna.farnsworth@earnest.com if you have questions or need information about this application.

This notice is subject to Earnest LLC's employee referral program.

JOB DESCRIPTION:


Nateras mission is to give couples the best chance of having a healthy child and we need your help to bring the latest technology in genetics together with advanced signal processing and statistics. We are hiring for a Senior Software QA Engineer.

Were building a team of SQA engineers who want to help develop software that lasts -- extensible, testable and self-documenting. No biology background is required but this is an excellent opportunity for a strong Senior Software QA Engineer who would like to bring their skills and expertise to the Life Science Industry. The ideal candidate for this position has solid Software Quality Assurance background and familiarity with test automation principles in a faced paced agile environment.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible for complete end-to-end validation of Natera cloud-based analytical platform, Laboratory Information
Management System (LIMS), and other software components.
Perform software validation analysis, define and document test plans and specifications required for regulatory compliance.
Participate in building and maintaining data-driven test automation framework using automation tools and libraries.
Perform debugging and root cause analysis of product issues or defects.
Evangelize new testing methodologies, best practices and tools with goals to continuously improve test coverage
Work closely with developers in all phases of SDLC to build quality into our development process.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum of 5 years of experience testing both front-end and server-side functionality of complex n-tier systems.
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
Extensive working knowledge of relational databases, strong SQL skills.
Recent hands-on experience with front-end test automation tools and libraries such as Selenium,, TestNG, Junit, ScalaTest, Gatling and others.
Familiarity with scripting and programming languages, such as Java, Groovy, Python, Scala, Ruby, Perl, etc
Strong knowledge of Linux and command line shell scripting.
Strong knowledge of QA methodologies, test planning, system dependencies, and product integration phases
OUR OPPORTUNITY

Driven by the passion for elevating the science and utility of genetic testing, Natera is committed to helping families identify and manage genetic diseases. Natera is a rapidly-growing diagnostics company with proprietary bioinformatics and molecular technology for analyzing DNA. Our complex technology has been proven clinically and commercially in the prenatal testing space and we are actively researching its applications in the liquid biopsy space for developing products with oncology applications.

The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, youll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, youll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.

WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive Benefits. Healthy catered lunches, Premium snacks and beverages, Onsite gym with cardio and weight-training equipment, Game room with satellite TV, Onsite dry cleaning and alteration service with pick-up and delivery, Employee-organized sports leagues, Happy hours and BBQs, Generous Employee Referral program.

For more information, visit www.natera.com.

Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation. We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.


What will you do at Ciena?

At Ciena we are building more adaptive networks in response to the constantly changing world. This is an opportunity to impact the world by developing software and hardware technologies that impact Global Networks, Private and Public Cloud Solutions, 4G/5G communications, and SD-WAN.

Developing great networking technology takes more than desire: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who reach out to the world through their respective talents. At Ciena, we provide multiple avenues for you to make the world a better place. If youre looking for more than just a job, we invite you to explore the opportunities available and apply today.

Responsibilities
Join an Agile scrum team to develop leading router and switching device control features for Cienas Packet Networking product offerings.
Deliver software in diverse, industry-leading product formats: as virtualized functions for NFV, integrated on Cienas advanced packet networking switches, and others.
Contribute automation scripts, schedule execution, and perform result analysis in our continuous integration system.
Create test cases, execute test suites within project timeline, defects validation, and documentation to deliver high quality excellent products.
Trouble shoot issues with various hardware platforms, routing protocols and services; identify root cause, diagnose, debug and document your finding.

Architect and design test methodology focus in platform dependent in hardware and software across system components including data plane / control plane interaction, device management, kernel, performance, negative testing and virtualized containers
Participate in all phases of software development life cycle, including design, product validation, documentation, and solving deployment issues
Work in an agile development environment and participate in sprint activities to plan and produce rapid cycle, high quality deliverables
Collaboration with stakeholders
Interact with Architects and Marketing to evaluate and address customer requirements and determine effective design approaches
Partner with peer development scrums to ensure excellent cross-component design
Work with Developers to verify the software and product work the way customers expect
Areas of impact
Contributing new features to Cienas SAOS network operating system, enabling new customers and markets
Enhancing SAOS support for new platforms in the Ciena 3000/5000 family, and 3rd party white box platforms
Accelerating time to market for Packet Software products and features
Experience
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in computer science or a related discipline. Masters preferred.
7+ years of applicable experience testing telecom networking and access products.
Working experience in automation with Python programming.
Knowledge with platform dependent and platform independent testing methodology experience.
Requires applied knowledge of any or all industry-standard networking protocols such as TCP/IP, VxLAN, EVPN, L2VPN, L3VPN, BGP, OSPF, ISIS, MPLS, LDP, Segment Routing.
Working knowledge with network industry test tools such as Ixia and open source tools.
Strong ability to reproduce internal or field issues in the lab, problem solving, troubleshooting and diagnostic skills.

About the Role

About the job
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.

You maintain and troubleshoot networking features and systems, collaborate internally to evaluate and resolve network designs and issues, and develop test plans and processes. You may also lead projects, providing expertise to team members, and manage projects timelines, resources and activities.
